definition[0]: in large amounts, to a high degree, or with great severity
example[0]: I became heavily involved in politics.
example[1]: The report was heavily criticized in the press.
example[4]: His wife was heavily pregnant at the time.
example[5]: It’s been raining heavily all day.
example[6]: Paul was drinking heavily by then.
example[7]: Britain is heavily dependent on imports for its raw materials.
definition[1]: if you do or say something heavily, you do it slowly and with a lot of effort, especially because you are sad or bored
example[8]: He was walking heavily, his head down.
